formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Wsadmin Absolute Path:
formElement.documentation: Path to wsadmin. If the location of wsadmin is in the PATH environment variable, then just the script name can be specified omitting its full path. E.g. '/path/to/wsadmin.sh' or 'wsadmin.bat'.

formElement.label: Connection Type:
formElement.documentation: Specifies to type of connection to use to connect to the application server that you want to administer. The valid choices are SOAP, RMI, and NONE. Default is SOAP.

formElement.label: Cell Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of cell to which EJB container belongs to.

formElement.label: Node Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of node to which EJB container belongs to.

formElement.label: Server Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of application server to which EJB container belongs to.

formElement.label: Passivation Directory:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the directory into which the container saves the persistent state of passivated stateful session beans. This directory must already exist. It is not automatically created.Default is ${USER_INSTALL_ROOT}/temp.

formElement.label: Cache Size:
formElement.documentation: Number of buckets in the active instance list within the EJB container.Input value range - greater than 0. The container selects the next largest prime number equal to or greater than the specified value.Default is 2053

formElement.label: Cleanup Interval:
formElement.documentation: Interval (in milliseconds)at which the container attempts to remove unused items from the cache.Default is 3000. Allowed range is 0 to 2147483647

formElement.label: Inactive Pool Cleanup Interval:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the interval at which the container examines the pools of available bean instances to determine if some instances can be deleted to reduce memory usage.

formElement.label: Enable stateful session bean fail over using memory-to-memory replication?:
formElement.documentation: Specifies that failover is enabled for all stateful session beans installed in this EJB container.Replication domains must already exist to failover feature to work.

formElement.label: Replication domain:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the replication domain in which HTTP sessions are replicated.

formElement.label: Replication Mode:
formElement.documentation: The mode specifies whether data is only sent (client), only received (server), or both. Select client if sessions need to be replicated. Select server if sessions need to be stored. Select both client and server if sessions need to be replicated and stored. The default is both.
